body:
### Problem

Older version of nvim correctly detects latest version of Neovim::Ext as 0.06 when using :checkhealth

Current dev version improperly reports current version incorrectly as 5 and with 0.06 installed being out of date as below:

- WARNING Module "Neovim::Ext" is out-of-date. Installed: 0.06, latest: 5
  - ADVICE:
    - Run in shell: cpanm -n Neovim::Ext

From what I can tell, the command to get the string to regex and get current version evaluates to the following on my local machine:

/usr/bin/perl -MApp::cpanminus::script -e 'my $app = App::cpanminus::script->new; $app->parse_options ("--info", "-q", "Neovim::Ext"); exit $app->doit'

which when run from command line gives an error containing "Can't locate App/cpanminus/script.pm in @INC (you may need to install the App::cpanminus::script"

cpan -i App::cpanminus::script fails on the local machine as follows:

>(error): Could not expand [App::cpanminus::script]. Check the module name.
>(info): I can suggest names if you install one of Text::Levenshtein::XS, Text::Levenshtein::Damerau::XS, Text::Levenshtein, and Text::Levenshtein::Damerau::PP
>(info): and you provide the -x option on invocation.
>(error): Skipping App::cpanminus::script because I couldn't find a matching namespace.


Perhaps this is a local perl configuration error, but I wanted to post as a possible bug report as the old way of checking for current Neovim::Ext in nvim 0.6.1 behaves as intended.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Install nvim from latest repo
2. run :checkhealth from within nvim
3. see that incorrect newest version of Neovim::Ext is 5 instead of 0.06

### Expected behavior

Expected behavior would be for current dev version to report that Neovim::Ext 0.06 is installed and is up to date

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

v0.10.0-dev

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

unknown

### Operating system/version

Linux Mint 21.1

### Terminal name/version

xterm-256color

### $TERM environment variable

screen.xterm-256color

### Installation

built from repo
title: Possible Issue in runtime/lua/provider/health.lua
